name: The Red Lion Inn

reviews.text: The Red Lion was a wonderful find.
reviews.title: Lovely country inn with great food
Great place to stay
reviews.text: It is in a lovely spot, a quiet and pretty village , but convenient for Stow and Bourton on the Water. Jamie the landlord was really friendly and helpful, but so were all the staff. Our room was lovely, overlooking the garden with super shower! We had a fantastic meal, great local ingredients and the menu is good offering lots of choice and some unusual choices. my husband would recommend the the steak pie! All in all a great find !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on a weekend break and have already arranged a return in November. It's a great country inn with two rooms on the first floor, set in a quiet hamlet within easy driving distance of a handful of lovely Cotswold towns. The shower room is a little small, but this is compensated for by the excellence of the shower itself. The bed was very comfortable-almost guaranteed to give you a great nights sleep and the room was very pleasant, including tea & coffee & complimentary bathrobes too! We were welcomed by landlord Jamie, who was a genial, charming, interesting and friendly host, who did all he could to make us feel welcome and ensured we enjoyed our stay, which we did in every way. He runs a tight ship and its clear every guest is valued. Make sure you try his rum home brew - you won't be sorry! Jamie's partner Esme runs a great kitchen which turns out fantastic breakfasts and a fabulous restaurant menu as well-see my review of the restaurant too!
reviews.title: Predictable pub grub

reviews.text: We visited the Red Lion for a Friday night supper when staying in the area for the weekend.
reviews.title: Weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first course was enjoyable - my partner enjoyed his pork terrine which was well presented, and I had the halloumi salad. His veggie main course, savoury pancakes, were stodgy, while my pork belly was OK. Nothing to write home about, though served with a smile.
reviews.title: pleasent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this really is a lovely place to stay beds are spotless you would never know they accept dogs. the only negative we found was the road noise, if you book this inn then be sure to book an evening meal as the food is delicious!!
reviews.title: TRULY FABULOUS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ...yes this may sound like some sort of overestimation of things but this is just scratching the surface of how wonderful our stay was at the Red Lion Inn LITTLE Compton.
reviews.title: One of the best night's sleep I've ever had!

reviews.text: We arrived in a mad rush as we were on our way to a wedding. Jamie (Landlord) calmly showed us to our room and left us to it. Although rather compact, the room felt bright, airy and clean. In the room there was a kettle a good selection of tea and coffee, bathrobes, plenty of towels a bath mat and a selection of soaps and toiletries. My only word of warning would be that those of you with long legs will struggle to sit on the loo and face forward, but this soon pales into insignificance (the place is that good!).
reviews.title: A truly old and very nice inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Following a superb night's rest we came down to breakfast (time agreed with Jamie the night before). Breakfast was a very tasty full English, complete with the tastiest black pudding I have had for some time. This was all accompanied by fresh toast, delicious, creamy butter, tea and coffee. We could not have asked for better service.
reviews.title: Great food and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jamie then recommended a walk we could take around some of the local fields before lunch. We lost ourselves in the wonderful hilly fields for about an hour and then hurried back for lunch. I do believe there are many restaurants that one could go to and order anything on the menu and find all choices to be delightful. I had the lamb chops and my partner had the pork. Both were heavenly. Accompanying our meal we sampled the excellent Donnigton Ales, SBA and BB. There may only be the two but they are more than adequate in flavour.
reviews.title: very good quality accommodation and food, lovely beer garden
Bad Choice
reviews.text: I have to say we were given a recommendation to go to this pub for food, so we decided to go and do a reckie and go for a drink first to gauge the atmosphere and ambience, as we often do. We entered the pub and thought how nice it looked, however on going to the bar we were told that this was the restaurant and we had to go next door to the bar area to have a drink. I have to say I was totally embarrased when arriving at the soleless bar area - complete with pool table, juke box and games machine. No fire, no atmosphere, no customers, just loud music. We live in the Cotswolds and are well endowed with fantastic atmospheric pubs to both eat and drink in. Sadly because of this experience we will never return to the Red Lion (Little Compton) to eat.

reviews.title: True gem
reviews.text: Brilliant food, great service, out ranks any food establishment in local Moreton on Marsh. We did not realise there was such a gem locally. We will be back.

reviews.title: Loved this Pub/Restaurant
reviews.text: Warm, friendly family atmosphere in this lovely old pub in the charming village of Little Compton.

reviews.title: Always a warm and friendly welcome
reviews.text: Food was excellent and we felt very comfortable here.

reviews.title: Brilliant service, high quality room and top notch food!
reviews.text: Lovely pub/restaurant, dog friendly and people friendly. The food is always up to scratch, hot, well presented and of good quality. Well deserved credit for this super little place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited a second time for Sunday lunch, our first experience a year ago being good. A complete contrast this time. Although we were welcomed and seated quickly our food order was simply forgotten. The table opposite arrived after us and whilst they were settling their bill (and 40 minutes after our arrival) we were told "your order will be with you shortly". It fast became a joke as the owner and staff passed us many times with other customer's food but ours still stuck in the kitchen. Apparently our order had got mislaid but it still took another 20 minutes before we were eventually served an hour after ordering.
reviews.title: Good food - poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this was my business I would have offered my customers a drink or proper apology but this didn't happen. We were now running late so paid the (full) bill and left. What a shame, our first visit left a lasting impression that ensured we went back. This weeks visit left us with just the opposite.
reviews.title: Excellent pub and accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. When we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly landlord who showed us our room, he said it was the smaller of the 2 rooms but gave us the option to move to the larger room the following day if we wished. As this pub was built in the17th century you have got to expect the rooms to be possibly on the small side, we found the small room to be adequate and very comfortable. The hosts were very hospitable and the food was brilliant. If you are looking for a quiet friendly pub with lots of character and excellent food this is the place to go.
reviews.title: Good pub restuarant with rooms

reviews.text: Not so much a hotel as such, really a pub/restuarant with 2 rooms. If you can get past the fact that you can't check in between 3pm and 6pm because the place is closed and the tiny bathroom the room and bed are very comfortable, the service in the restaurant is very good and so is the food, in fact highly recommended. We were the only couple staying when we visited but they made us feel very welcome. If you don't want to pay £200 on a country house hotel this is very good quality for the price.
reviews.title: Traditional Pub, Luxurious Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Red Lion Inn is definitely the best of all worlds. Staying here for 4 nights on a cycling holiday we were given a warm welcome from the offset. The oak beamed room 1 (hooky hall, 1 of 2) was comfortable and well appointed. The pub itself splits itself between two worlds very successfully. The restaurant side has a great ambience and we had fantastic cuisine; I'm a vegetarian, and it provided enough choice for me to dine her on all 4 nights, which is unheard of at an inn. If you want a traditional pub, the public bar offers a traditional friendly welcome with pool table and television. It's a Donnington Brewery pub, and the standard real ale is a 3.6% B.B. You will find there is noise from the kitchens in your room whilst the kitchen is open, but this closes at 9 and the the owner runs a tight ship and ensures guests are never disturbed.
reviews.title: Rudeness

aka: The Red Lion Hotel Little Compton
